section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

def.name: AuthorizedSignatory
def.leadIn: authorized signatory (獲授權簽署人), in relation to any type of minor works under any class, means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose name is entered in the register as an authorized signatory of a registered minor works contractor for that type of minor works under section 12(7)(a)(ii), 19(4)(a)(ii), 23(7)(a)(ii) or 25(7); or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: designated exempted works (指定豁免工程)—see sections 5 and 72; (L.N. 60 of 2020)
designated trade division (指定工種分項) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583); (22 of 2014 s. 42)
disciplinary order (紀律制裁命令) means an order made under section 13(4) of the Ordinance;
prescribed plans and details (訂明圖則及詳圖) means the plans and details prescribed in regulation 8 of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A);
provisional register (臨時名冊) means the provisional register of minor works contractors kept under section 8A(1)(c) of the Ordinance;
Registration Committee (註冊事務委員會) means a Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee appointed under section 6(1);
technical memorandum (技術備忘錄) means a technical memorandum issued under section 39A of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), in this Regulation— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: class I minor works (第I級別小型工程) means any item of minor works specified in Division 1 of Part 3 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: class II minor works (第II級別小型工程) means any item of minor works specified in Division 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: class III minor works (第III級別小型工程) means any item of minor works specified in Division 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1,

subsection.continued: and a reference to class, class I, class II or class III is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), in this Regulation— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to an item of minor works is a reference to the building works specified in column 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the item number in column 1 of that Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to item is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), in this Regulation— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a type of minor works is a reference to the item or items of minor works under different classes specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 under a Division heading referring to that type of minor works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to type is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: For any building works to which Part 11 applies, subsections (2), (3) and (4) have effect subject to that Part. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Matters Designated or Prescribed for Purposes of Ordinance

section.name: s3
section.heading: Minor works
section.content: For the purposes of the definition of minor works in section 2(1) of the Ordinance, class I minor works, class II minor works and class III minor works are designated as minor works.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Simplified requirements
section.content: For the purposes of the definition of simplified requirements in section 2(1) of the Ordinance, the requirements in Part 6 are prescribed as simplified requirements.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Designated exempted works
section.content: For the purposes of section 41(3B) of the Ordinance, the building works specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 are prescribed as designated exempted works.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Establishment of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee

subsection.content: The Building Authority must establish a panel from which the Authority is to appoint committees to be known as the Minor Works Contractors Registration Committees.
There may be more than one Registration Committee in action at any one time.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Composition of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee

subsection.leadIn: A Registration Committee must consist of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 person nominated by the Building Authority who, in the opinion of the Authority, has knowledge and experience in minor works; (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 authorized person or registered structural engineer selected by the Building Authority from among persons nominated by the Architects Registration Board, the Engineers Registration Board or the Surveyors Registration Board; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 person selected by the Building Authority from among persons nominated by such bodies as the Authority thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is a member of the following panel is not eligible for appointment to the Registration Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authorized Persons’, Registered Structural Engineers’ and Registered Geotechnical Engineers’ Disciplinary Board Panel appointed under section 5A of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registered Contractors’ Disciplinary Board Panel appointed under section 11A of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The members of the Registration Committee must elect from among themselves a member to act as the chairperson of the Committee.
The Building Authority must appoint an officer of the Buildings Department as the secretary of the Registration Committee.
The secretary of the Registration Committee is not a member of the Committee.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Function of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee
section.leadIn: The function of a Registration Committee is to assist the Building Authority in considering applications under Parts 4 and 10 by— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: examining the qualifications of the applicants;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: making necessary inquiry to ascertain whether the applicants have the experience required of them for the purposes of their applications;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conducting interviews with the applicants;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: making recommendations to the Authority to allow or refuse, either in whole or in part, the applications or defer the determination of the applications; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: reviewing the decisions of the Authority or recommendations of other Registration Committees under section 26. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Meeting of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee

subsection.content: A Registration Committee is to meet as often as the Building Authority directs.
No meeting of the Registration Committee may proceed in the absence of any of its members.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Registration as Registered Minor Works Contractor

division.name: D1
division.heading: Registration as Registered Minor Works Contractor

section.name: s10
section.heading: Application for registration as registered minor works contractor

subsection.leadIn: A person may apply to the Building Authority for registration as a registered minor works contractor for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a natural person, one or more items of class III minor works; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is not a natural person, one or more types of minor works under one or more classes.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: In the case of an application under subsection (1)(b), the applicant must, in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, nominate in the application form at least one individual who is proposed to be an authorized signatory of the applicant to act for it for the purposes of the Ordinance on its registration as a registered minor works contractor.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Determination of application made under section 10(1)(a)

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must, within 3 months from receiving an application under section 10(1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is registered under the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583) as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division which is relevant to the item or items of class III minor works to which the application relates; or (22 of 2014 s. 43)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has the ability and skills to personally carry out the item or items of class III minor works to which the application relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant has completed a training course on class III minor works that is recognized by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable for registration in the register.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the purposes of subsection (2)(d), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b), the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the applicant’s name in the register together with information identifying the item or items of class III minor works for which the applicant is registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the applicant’s name in the Gazette together with information identifying the item or items of class III minor works for which the applicant is registered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration to the applicant endorsed with information identifying the item or items of class III minor works for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.content: If the Building Authority refuses an application under subsection (1)(b) or (c), the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Determination of application made under section 10(1)(b)

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may refer, either in whole or in part, an application under section 10(1)(b) to a Registration Committee for recommendation if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter that is relevant for determining whether the applicant complies with the requirements set out in subsections (5) and (6). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority does not refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Building Authority considers it appropriate to refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the application, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refers an application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from the meeting of the Committee at which the application is considered— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: defer the determination of the application for a period not exceeding 6 months, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: refer the application again to a Registration Committee for recommendation after that period on the request of the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the request, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (3)(a) or (b) unless the Registration Committee so recommends.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, at least one individual nominated under section 10(3) for that type of minor works—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has the ability to understand that type of minor works through relevant experience and a general knowledge of the basic statutory requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has access to plants and resources;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its management structure is adequate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at least one of its directors has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable for registration in the register.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the purposes of subsection (5)(d), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant and the individual nominated under section 10(3) have any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the applicant or the individual.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b), the Authority must, on payment by the applicant of the prescribed fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter the applicant’s name in the register together with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: information identifying the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the authorized signatory of the applicant for each type of minor works under each class for which the applicant is registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the applicant’s name in the Gazette together with information identifying the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration to the applicant endorsed with information identifying the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses an application under subsection (2)(b) or (c) or (3)(b) or (c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defers the determination of an application under subsection (3)(d),

subsection.continued: the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Validity period of registration
section.content: Subject to section 14(3) and any relevant disciplinary order, the registration of a person under section 11 or 12 expires on the third anniversary of the date of the entry of the person’s name in the register under section 11(4) or 12(7).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Renewal of Registration as Registered Minor Works Contractor

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application for renewal of registration as registered minor works contractor

subsection.content: A registered minor works contractor may apply to the Building Authority for the renewal of the contractor’s registration.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be submitted to the Building Authority not more than 4 months but not less than 28 days prior to the expiry of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: If a registered minor works contractor makes an application for the renewal of the contractor’s registration under subsection (1) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application or any part of the application is allowed under section 15(2)(a) or (b) or (2B)(a) or (b) after the expiry of the registration; or (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration expires before the date specified in the notice under section 15(5)(b) on which the registration or any part of the registration ceases to be valid,

subsection.continued: subject to any relevant disciplinary order, the registration or part of the registration continues to be in force after its expiry until the date on which it is allowed or ceases to be valid.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Determination of application for renewal of registration

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may refer, either in whole or in part, an application under section 14(1) to a Registration Committee for recommendation if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter that is relevant for determining whether the applicant complies with the requirements set out in subsection (3). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority does not refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Building Authority considers it appropriate to refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the application, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refers an application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from the meeting of the Committee at which the application is considered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (2B)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that the applicant complies with the applicable requirements for registration set out in section 11(2) and (3) or 12(5) and (6). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (2B)(a) or (b), the Authority must— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend the entry in respect of the applicant in the register to reflect the renewal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration to the applicant endorsed with information identifying the item or items of class III minor works, or the type or types of minor works under one or more classes, for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refuses an application under subsection (2)(b) or (c) or (2B)(b) or (c), the Authority must— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the written notice the date, which must not be earlier than the expiry of the existing registration, on which the registration or part of the registration will cease to be valid.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Validity period of renewed registration
section.content: Subject to section 14(3) and any relevant disciplinary order, a registration renewed under section 15 expires on the third anniversary of the expiry date of the previous registration.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Removal of name of registered minor works contractor

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must remove the name of a registered minor works contractor from the register if the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not receive an application by the contractor for the renewal of registration in accordance with section 14; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has refused an application for the renewal of the registration concerned under section 15(2)(c) or (2B)(c) and given a notice under section 15(5) to the contractor. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The removal of a name under subsection (1)(a) is effective immediately after the expiry of the registration.
The removal of a name under subsection (1)(b) is effective on the date specified in the notice under section 15(5)(b).

section.name: s18
section.heading: Application for restoration of name to register

subsection.content: A person whose name is removed under section 17(1) may, within 2 years from the expiry of the registration concerned, apply to the Building Authority for the restoration of the person’s name to the register.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Determination of application for restoration of name to register

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may refer, either in whole or in part, an application under section 18(1) to a Registration Committee for recommendation if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter that is relevant for determining whether the applicant complies with the requirements set out in subsection (3). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority does not refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Building Authority considers it appropriate to refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the application, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refers an application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from the meeting of the Committee at which the application is considered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (2B)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that the applicant complies with the applicable requirements for registration set out in section 11(2) and (3) or 12(5) and (6). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (2B)(a) or (b), the Authority must— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter the applicant’s name in the register together with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: information identifying the item or items of class III minor works, or the type or types of minor works under one or more classes, for which the applicant is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is registered for one or more types of minor works under one or more classes, the name of the authorized signatory of the applicant for each type of minor works under each class for which the applicant is registered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration to the applicant endorsed with information identifying the item or items of class III minor works, or the type or types of minor works under one or more classes, for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.content: If the Building Authority refuses an application under subsection (2)(b) or (c) or (2B)(b) or (c), the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Validity period of restored registration
section.content: Subject to section 14(3) and any relevant disciplinary order, the registration of a person whose name is restored under section 19 to the register expires on the third anniversary of the date of restoration.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Registration of Additional Class, Type or Item of Minor Works

section.name: s21
section.heading: Application for registration of additional class, type or item of minor works

subsection.content: A registered minor works contractor who is registered under section 11 may apply to the Building Authority for the addition to the contractor’s registration of one or more additional items of class III minor works.

subsection.leadIn: A registered minor works contractor who is registered under section 12 may apply to the Building Authority for the addition to the contractor’s registration of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one or more additional types of minor works under one or more classes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more additional classes of minor works of the type or types for which the contractor is registered.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) or (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: In the case of an application under subsection (2), the applicant must, in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, nominate in the application form at least one individual who is proposed to be an authorized signatory of the applicant to act for it for the purposes of the Ordinance on the addition of that type or class of minor works to its registration.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Determination of application made under section 21(1)

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must, within 3 months from receiving an application under section 21(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is registered under the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583) as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division which is relevant to the item or items of class III minor works to which the application relates; or (22 of 2014 s. 44)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has the ability and skills to personally carry out the item or items of class III minor works to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the item or items of class III minor works to which the application relates.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the purposes of subsection (2)(c), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b), the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend the entry in respect of the applicant in the register by adding information identifying the additional item or items of class III minor works for which the applicant is registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a new certificate of registration to the applicant to replace the applicant’s existing certificate of registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: endorse on the new certificate of registration information identifying the items of class III minor works for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.content: If the Building Authority refuses an application under subsection (1)(b) or (c), the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Determination of application made under section 21(2)

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may refer, either in whole or in part, an application under section 21(2) to a Registration Committee for recommendation if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter that is relevant for determining whether the applicant complies with the requirements set out in subsections (5) and (6). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority does not refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Building Authority considers it appropriate to refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the application, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refers an application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from the meeting of the Committee at which the application is considered— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: defer the determination of the application for a period not exceeding 6 months, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: refer the application again to a Registration Committee for recommendation after that period on the request of the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the request, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (3)(a) or (b) unless the Registration Committee so recommends.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, at least one individual nominated under section 21(4) for that type of minor works—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has the ability to understand that type of minor works through relevant experience and a general knowledge of the basic statutory requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has access to plants and resources;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its management structure is adequate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at least one of its directors has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the applicant is suitable for registration in the register for the purposes of subsection (5)(d), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant and the individual nominated under section 21(4) have any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the applicant or the individual.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b), the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: amend the entry in respect of the applicant in the register by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adding information identifying the additional type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: entering the name of the authorized signatory of the applicant for each additional type of minor works under each class for which the applicant is registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a new certificate of registration to the applicant to replace the applicant’s existing certificate of registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: endorse on the new certificate of registration information identifying the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses an application under subsection (2)(b) or (c) or (3)(b) or (c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defers the determination of an application under subsection (3)(d),

subsection.continued: the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Application for approval of nomination of additional authorized signatory

subsection.content: A registered minor works contractor who is registered under section 12 may apply to the Building Authority for approval of the nomination of an additional individual as its authorized signatory to act for it for the purposes of the Ordinance for one or more types of minor works under one or more classes for which the contractor is registered.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Determination of application made under section 24(1)

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may refer, either in whole or in part, an application under section 24(1) to a Registration Committee for recommendation if the Authority considers it appropriate to do so after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes to which the application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter that is relevant for determining whether the applicant complies with the requirements set out in subsections (5) and (6). (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority does not refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Building Authority considers it appropriate to refer the application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the application, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority refers an application to a Registration Committee, the Authority must, within 3 months from the meeting of the Committee at which the application is considered— (L.N. 113 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: defer the determination of the application for a period not exceeding 6 months, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: refer the application again to a Registration Committee for recommendation after that period on the request of the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: direct the Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the request, to consider the application. (L.N. 113 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (3)(a) or (b) unless the Registration Committee so recommends.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that, in respect of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the individual concerned is nominated, the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the ability to understand the type or types of minor works through relevant experience and a general knowledge of the basic statutory requirements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is suitable to act for the applicant for the purposes of the Ordinance as its authorized signatory.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the individual concerned is suitable to act for the applicant for the purposes of subsection (5)(c), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the individual has any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the individual.

subsection.content: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b), the Authority must enter in the register the name of the individual concerned as an authorized signatory of the applicant for the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the nomination is approved.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses an application under subsection (2)(b) or (c) or (3)(b) or (c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defers the determination of an application under subsection (3)(d),

subsection.continued: the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Review of decisions of Building Authority or recommendations of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee

subsection.leadIn: A person who is aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Building Authority to defer the determination of the person’s application under section 12, 23 or 25; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a recommendation of a Registration Committee made in respect of the person’s application for the purposes of section 12, 15, 19, 23 or 25,

subsection.continued: may request a Registration Committee to review the decision or recommendation.

subsection.leadIn: The request must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the substance of the matter and reasons for requesting the review; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be submitted to the Building Authority within 28 days from the date on which the reasons for the decision, or the decision to which the recommendation relates, were given to the person under section 11(5), 12(8), 15(5)(a), 19(5), 22(5), 23(8), 25(8) or 65(6).

subsection.content: The request does not affect the operation of the decision or the effect of the recommendation.
On receiving the request, the Building Authority must direct a Registration Committee to meet, within 3 months from receiving the request, to review the decision or recommendation.
The Registration Committee must not consist of any member who has considered the application to which the decision or recommendation relates.

In reviewing the decision or recommendation, the Registration Committee may consider any information or documentary proof that was not provided to the Building Authority or the Registration Committee concerned when the decision or recommendation was made.

subsection.leadIn: The Registration Committee may advise the Building Authority to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm the decision, or the decision to which the recommendation relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: substitute the decision, or the decision to which the recommendation relates, with such other decision as the Committee thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Within 3 months from receiving the advice of the Registration Committee in respect of the request, the Building Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: having regard to the advice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: confirm the decision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (9), substitute the decision with such other decision as the Authority thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notify the person making the request in writing of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the advice of the Committee and the reasons for the advice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the decision of the Authority under paragraph (a) and the reasons for the decision.

subsection.content: The Building Authority may make a decision to allow the application to which the request relates only if the Registration Committee so advises.

section.name: s26A
section.heading: Appeal against advice of Minor Works Contractors Registration Committee or decisions of Building Authority under section 26

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by any advice of a Registration Committee, or a decision of the Building Authority, made in respect of the person’s request under section 26 may appeal to the Court of First Instance.
The practice for the appeal is subject to any rules of court made under the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4).

division.name: D7
division.heading: Building Authority’s Powers Relating to Register and Certificate of Registration

section.name: s26B
section.heading: Power to amend register
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 11(4)(a), 12(7)(a), 15(4)(a), 17(1), 19(4)(a), 22(4)(a), 23(7)(a) and 25(7), the Building Authority may amend the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in circumstances that necessitate an amendment to the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any way the Authority considers appropriate.

section.name: s26C
section.heading: Power to reissue certificate of registration
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 11(4)(c), 12(7)(c), 15(4)(b), 19(4)(b), 22(4)(b) and (c) and 23(7)(b) and (c), the Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue a new certificate of registration to a registered minor works contractor to replace the contractor’s existing certificate of registration in circumstances that necessitate a replacement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue the new certificate in any way the Authority considers appropriate.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Appointment of Persons in respect of Minor Works

section.name: s27
section.heading: Prescribed building professionals to be appointed for purposes of section 4A of Ordinance
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 4A of the Ordinance, the following prescribed building professionals are required to be appointed in respect of class I minor works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized person, or, if the works are a prescribed repair or any associated demolition works, a registered inspector assuming the role of an authorized person in respect of the works; (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the works involve any structural elements, a registered structural engineer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the works involve any geotechnical elements, a registered geotechnical engineer.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Prescribed registered contractors to be appointed for purposes of section 9AA of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9AA of the Ordinance, the following prescribed registered contractor is required to be appointed in respect of class I minor works, class II minor works or class III minor works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered general building contractor;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: if the works fall within the description of item 1.11, 1.12, 2.10 or 2.11 of Part 3 of Schedule 1, a registered specialist contractor whose name is entered in the foundation works category in the specialist contractors sub-register;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the works fall within the description of item 1.12 or 2.11 of Part 3 of Schedule 1, a registered specialist contractor whose name is entered in the ground investigation field works category in the specialist contractors sub-register;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: if the works fall within the description of item 1.46, 1.51, 2.42 or 2.46 of Part 3 of Schedule 1, a registered specialist contractor whose name is entered in the ventilation works category in the specialist contractors sub-register; or (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a registered minor works contractor who is registered for the type or item of minor works to be carried out. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subsection.def: In this section, specialist contractors sub-register (專門承建商分冊) means a sub-register in the register of specialist contractors maintained under section 8A(2) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.content: In this Part, a reference to a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 includes a prescribed building professional nominated to act in the place of another prescribed building professional under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Requirements in respect of Class I Minor Works

section.name: s30
section.heading: Documents to be submitted before commencement of class I minor works
section.leadIn: Not less than 7 days before the commencement of any class I minor works, the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the name of each person appointed as a prescribed building professional under section 27 and as a prescribed registered contractor under section 28 (appointed person) in respect of the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each appointed person has confirmed the appointment;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the authorized person or registered inspector has confirmed the date on which the works are to be commenced; (L.N. 148 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the works comprise repairs, alterations or additions to any building, the authorized person or registered inspector and registered structural engineer (if any) appointed under section 27 in respect of the works have certified that, after inspecting the building, they are of the opinion that the building is capable of bearing the loads and stresses which may be increased or altered in any way as a result of the works; and (L.N. 148 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: if the works involve the erection of a signboard, the person for whom the signboard is to be erected has provided the particulars of the person as required by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the physical condition of the premises where the works are to be carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribed plans and details of the works; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if required by the technical memorandum, a supervision plan.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Documents to be submitted on completion of class I minor works other than demolition works
section.leadIn: Within 14 days after the date of completion of any class I minor works other than demolition works, the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the works as completed are different from those shown in the prescribed plans and details referred to in section 30(c), the revised prescribed plans and details showing the works as completed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the works as completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: each prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 and the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works have certified that the works have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance and the prescribed plans and details referred to in paragraph (a) or section 30(c);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the authorized person or registered inspector has confirmed the date on which the works were completed; (L.N. 148 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the authorized person or registered inspector has certified that the works are, in the opinion of the person or inspector, structurally safe; (L.N. 148 of 2011; L.N. 182 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if a registered structural engineer has been appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the engineer has certified that the works are structurally safe in the opinion of the engineer; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: if a registered geotechnical engineer has been appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the engineer has certified that the works are geotechnically safe in the opinion of the engineer.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Documents to be submitted on completion of class I minor works that are demolition works
section.leadIn: Within 14 days after the date of completion of any class I minor works that are demolition works, the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the works as completed are different from those shown in the prescribed plans and details referred to in section 30(c), the revised prescribed plans and details showing the works as completed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the works as completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: each prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 and the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works have certified that the works have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance and the prescribed plans and details referred to in paragraph (a) or section 30(c);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the authorized person or registered inspector has confirmed the date on which the works were completed; (L.N. 148 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the authorized person or registered inspector has certified that any land or street affected by the works has an adequate margin of safety and any structure remaining on the premises is, in the opinion of the person or inspector, structurally safe; (L.N. 148 of 2011; L.N. 182 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if a registered structural engineer has been appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the engineer has certified that any land or street affected by the works has an adequate margin of safety and any structure remaining on the premises is structurally safe in the opinion of the engineer; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: if a registered geotechnical engineer has been appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the engineer has certified that any land or street affected by the works has an adequate margin of safety and any structure remaining on the premises is geotechnically safe in the opinion of the engineer.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Requirements in respect of Class II Minor Works

section.name: s33
section.heading: Documents to be submitted before commencement of class II minor works
section.leadIn: Not less than 7 days before the commencement of any class II minor works, the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the contractor as the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the contractor has confirmed the appointment and the date on which the works are to be commenced;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the works comprise repairs, alterations or additions to any building, the contractor has certified that, after inspecting the building, the contractor is of the opinion that the building is capable of bearing the loads and stresses which may be increased or altered in any way as a result of the works; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the works involve the erection of a signboard, the person for whom the signboard is to be erected has provided the particulars of the person as required by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the physical condition of the premises where the works are to be carried out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribed plans and details of the works.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Documents to be submitted on completion of class II minor works other than demolition works
section.leadIn: Within 14 days after the date of completion of any class II minor works other than demolition works, the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the works as completed are different from those shown in the prescribed plans and details referred to in section 33(c), the revised prescribed plans and details showing the works as completed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the works as completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate in the specified form, in which the contractor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has certified that the works have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance and the prescribed plans and details referred to in paragraph (a) or section 33(c);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has confirmed the date on which the works were completed; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has certified that the works are structurally safe in the opinion of the contractor.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Documents to be submitted on completion of class II minor works that are demolition works
section.leadIn: Within 14 days after the date of completion of any class II minor works that are demolition works, the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the works as completed are different from those shown in the prescribed plans and details referred to in section 33(c), the revised prescribed plans and details showing the works as completed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs showing the works as completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate in the specified form, in which the contractor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has certified that the works have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance and the prescribed plans and details referred to in paragraph (a) or section 33(c);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has confirmed the date on which the works were completed; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has certified that any land or street affected by the works has an adequate margin of safety and any structure remaining on the premises is structurally safe in the opinion of the contractor.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Requirements in respect of Class III Minor Works

section.name: s36
section.heading: Documents to be submitted on completion of class III minor works
section.leadIn: Within 14 days after the date of completion of any class III minor works, the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works must submit to the Building Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the contractor as the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the contractor has confirmed the appointment and the dates on which the works were commenced and completed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the contractor has certified that the works have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance and the plans or description of works referred to in paragraph (b);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the contractor is a registered minor works contractor registered under section 11, the contractor has certified that the contractor has personally carried out the works; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: if the works involve the erection of a signboard, the person for whom the signboard is to be erected has provided the particulars of the person as required by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the plans or description of works showing the works as completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: photographs showing the physical condition of the premises immediately before the commencement and after the completion of the works.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Plans etc. to be signed by person preparing them

subsection.leadIn: All prescribed plans and details of class I minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be prepared and signed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of foundation plans, structural details or calculations for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any class I minor works specified in subsection (4), the authorized person or registered structural engineer appointed under section 27 in respect of the works;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any class I minor works other than those specified in subsection (4), the registered structural engineer appointed under section 27 in respect of the works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of geotechnical plans, geotechnical assessment, geotechnical details or calculations and geotechnical reports, the registered geotechnical engineer appointed under section 27 in respect of the works;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works. (L.N. 148 of 2011)

subsection.content: All prescribed plans and details of class II minor works and plans of class III minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be prepared and signed by the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works.

The person who has signed the prescribed plans and details or plans under subsection (1) or (2) is regarded as having agreed to assume all responsibilities under the Ordinance regarding the prescribed plans and details or plans.

subsection.leadIn: Class I minor works that satisfy the following criteria are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the construction does not exceed 10 m;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the span of any structural element of the construction does not exceed 6 m;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the structural elements are constructed of timber, masonry, steel, plain concrete or reinforced concrete;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the foundations of the construction are of the spread footing type with a ground bearing pressure not exceeding 300 kPa and founded at not more than 2 m below existing ground level; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: there is no structural alteration to any existing structural elements designed by a registered structural engineer.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Ratio of plans

subsection.content: Every plan and section of minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be drawn to a ratio of not less than 1:100.
Every block plan of minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be drawn to a ratio of not less than 1:500.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Plans to be clear and material of plan

subsection.leadIn: Every plan of minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be drawn or reproduced— (L.N. 223 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a clear and intelligible manner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if submitted in hard copy form—on a suitable and durable material. (L.N. 223 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Every plan of minor works required to be submitted under this Part must be so coloured as to clearly differentiate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: existing works from new works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one part of any new works from the other parts of the new works.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: hard copy form (印本形式) means a paper form or similar form capable of being read without the aid of any equipment. (L.N. 223 of 2021)

part.name: P7
part.heading: Duties of Prescribed Building Professional and Prescribed Registered Contractor

section.name: s40
section.heading: Application of Part 7
section.content: This Part applies only to minor works commenced or carried out under the simplified requirements.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Duties to Supervise Minor Works and Appoint Technically Competent Person

section.name: s41
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 2
section.content: In this Division, a reference to a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 includes a prescribed building professional nominated to act in the place of another prescribed building professional under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Duty of prescribed building professional to supervise minor works

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works must give such periodical supervision and make such inspections as may be necessary to ensure that— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the works are carried out in general accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any order made or condition imposed in relation to the works by the Building Authority under the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no material divergence or deviation from the prescribed plans and details submitted in respect of the works under section 30(c).

subsection.leadIn: A registered structural engineer appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works must give such periodical supervision and make such inspections as may be necessary to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the structural works are carried out in general accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any order made or condition imposed in relation to the minor works by the Building Authority under the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no material divergence or deviation from the prescribed plans and details submitted in respect of the structural works under section 30(c).

subsection.leadIn: A registered geotechnical engineer appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works must give such periodical supervision and make such inspections as may be necessary to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the geotechnical works are carried out in general accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any order made or condition imposed in relation to the minor works by the Building Authority under the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no material divergence or deviation from the prescribed plans and details submitted in respect of the geotechnical works under section 30(c).

section.name: s43
section.heading: Duty of prescribed registered contractor to supervise minor works

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a registered minor works contractor who is registered under section 11.

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any minor works must, during the carrying out of the works, give continuous supervision to the carrying out of the works to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the works are carried out in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any order made or condition imposed in relation to the works by the Building Authority under the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of class I minor works or class II minor works, there is no material divergence or deviation from the prescribed plans and details submitted in respect of the works under section 30(c) or 33(c).

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any minor works must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep records of activities and information relevant to the supervision of the works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: retain the records and information for at least 12 months after the completion of the works.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Duty of registered minor works contractor to carry out minor works personally
section.leadIn: A registered minor works contractor registered under section 11 who is appointed under section 28 in respect of any class III minor works must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out the works personally; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ensure that the works are carried out in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any order made or condition imposed in relation to the works by the Building Authority under the Ordinance.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Prescribed building professional and prescribed registered contractor must appoint technically competent person

subsection.leadIn: If the technical memorandum requires a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 or a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any class I minor works to appoint any technically competent persons to supervise the carrying out of the works, the professional or contractor must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint an appropriate number of technically competent persons to give such supervision as may be required under the supervision plan submitted under section 30(d) or 48(2)(b) or (3)(b) on each site for which the professional or contractor is appointed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 7 days before the commencement of the works, notify the Building Authority in writing of the appointment under paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide the Building Authority with the particulars, qualifications and experience of the persons appointed under paragraph (a) as required by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If there is any change in an appointment made under subsection (1)(a), the person who made the appointment must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 7 days after the date of the change, notify the Building Authority in writing of that fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the change involves the appointment of another technically competent person under subsection (1)(a), provide the Building Authority with the particulars, qualifications and experience of the person as required by the Authority.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Building Authority may reject appointment of technically competent person

subsection.content: The Building Authority may reject the appointment of any technically competent person under section 45(1)(a) if the Authority is not satisfied that the qualifications or experience of the person is sufficient for performing the duties required of the person under the supervision plan submitted under section 30(d) or 48(2)(b) or (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If an appointment is rejected under subsection (1), the Building Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the person who made the appointment of the rejection by sending a notice by registered post to the last known address of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date of rejection in the notice.

subsection.content: An appointment rejected under subsection (1) ceases to have effect from the date specified under subsection (2)(b).

section.name: s47
section.heading: Works must not be carried out if appointment of technically competent person is terminated or ceases to have effect
section.content: If the appointment of any technically competent person under section 45(1)(a) is terminated or ceases to have effect under section 46(3), the person who made the appointment must not commence or, if the works have already commenced, must cease the carrying out of any part of the minor works that is under the supervision of the technically competent person until another technically competent person is appointed under section 45(1)(a) in respect of the part.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Duties in respect of Appointment and Nomination and Cessation of Appointment and Nomination of Prescribed Building Professional and Prescribed Registered Contractor

section.name: s48
section.heading: Duty of prescribed building professional and prescribed registered contractor on change in appointment

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notification of the appointment of a prescribed building professional or prescribed registered contractor (original appointed person) has been submitted under section 30(a) or 33(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the original appointed person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is unable to act, whether by reason of the termination of the appointment or for any other reason; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is unwilling to act; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: another person (new appointed person) is appointed under section 27 or 28 in the place of the original appointed person.

subsection.leadIn: If the minor works concerned are class I minor works and the new appointed person is not an authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works must, within 7 days after the date of the appointment, submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the new appointed person as a person appointed under section 27 or 28 in the place of the original appointed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the new appointed person has confirmed the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the technical memorandum, a revised supervision plan.

subsection.leadIn: If the minor works concerned are class I minor works and the new appointed person is an authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of the works, the new appointed person must, within 7 days after the date of the appointment, submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the new appointed person as a person appointed under section 27 in the place of the original appointed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the new appointed person has confirmed the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the technical memorandum, a revised supervision plan.

subsection.leadIn: If the minor works concerned are class II minor works, the prescribed registered contractor appointed as the new appointed person must, within 7 days after the date of the appointment, submit to the Building Authority a notification in the specified form, in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who arranged for the works to be carried out has specified the contractor as a person appointed under section 28 in the place of the original appointed person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contractor has confirmed the appointment.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Duty of prescribed building professional in case of nomination under section 4A(5) of Ordinance
