section.leadIn: If a prescribed building professional (nominator) appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works has nominated another prescribed building professional (nominee) under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance to act in the place of the nominator, the nominator must, within 7 days after the date of the nomination, submit to the Building Authority a notification in the specified form, in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nominator has specified the nominee as a person nominated under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: both the nominator and the nominee have confirmed the nomination.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Duty of prescribed building professional on ceasing to be appointed or nominated
section.content: If a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 or nominated under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance in respect of any class I minor works ceases to be appointed or nominated, the professional must, within 7 days after the date of the cessation, notify the Building Authority in writing of that fact.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Duty of prescribed registered contractor on ceasing to be appointed

subsection.leadIn: If a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any class I minor works ceases to be appointed, the contractor must, within 7 days after the date of the cessation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver to the authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 or nominated under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance in respect of the works a notice, in the specified form, of that fact; and (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certify in the notice that the works carried out by the contractor have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any class II minor works ceases to be appointed, the contractor must, within 7 days after the date of the cessation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: submit to the Building Authority a notice, in the specified form, of that fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certify in the notice that the works carried out by the contractor have been carried out in accordance with the Ordinance.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Duty of authorized person or registered inspector on being delivered notice under section 51(1)
section.content: Any authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 or nominated under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance in respect of any class I minor works must, within 7 days after the date of receipt of any notice delivered to the authorized person or registered inspector under section 51(1), submit the notice to the Building Authority.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Works must not be carried out if prescribed building professional or prescribed registered contractor is unable or unwilling to act

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works has, during the carrying out of the works, become unable or unwilling to act; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no one is nominated to act in the place of the professional,

subsection.continued: the prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works must cease the carrying out of the works until another prescribed building professional is appointed under section 27 in respect of the works.

subsection.content: If a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any class I minor works has, during the carrying out of the works, become unable or unwilling to act, the prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 in respect of the works must cease the carrying out of the works until another prescribed registered contractor is appointed under section 28 in respect of the works.

division.name: D4
division.heading: General Duties of Prescribed Building Professional and Prescribed Registered Contractor

section.name: s54
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 4
section.content: In this Division, a reference to a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 includes a prescribed building professional nominated to act in the place of another prescribed building professional under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Duty of authorized person or registered inspector to deliver copy of prescribed plans and details etc. to prescribed registered contractor
section.leadIn: An authorized person or registered inspector appointed under section 27 in respect of any class I minor works must deliver to a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of the works— (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the prescribed plans and details submitted under section 30(c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the technical memorandum, a copy of the supervision plan submitted under section 30(d) or 48(2)(b) or (3)(b).

section.name: s56
section.heading: Duty of person who has prepared plans or documents to provide to Building Authority such information as may be required
section.content: If a prescribed building professional appointed under section 27 or a prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any minor works has prepared any plans or documents which have been submitted to the Building Authority under this Part or Part 6, the professional or contractor must provide to the Authority such information as the Authority may require with regard to the works.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Duty of prescribed registered contractor to keep record of prescribed plans and details and supervision plans on site
section.leadIn: A prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28 in respect of any class I minor works or class II minor works must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep on the site on which the works are carried out copies of all prescribed plans and details submitted under section 30(c) or 33(c) and all supervision plans (if any) submitted under section 30(d) or 48(2)(b) or (3)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the copies to the Building Authority at such time as the Authority may require.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Offences
section.content: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35 or 36 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Power of Building Authority to inspect records and information
section.content: The Building Authority may at any reasonable time inspect the records and information required to be kept under section 43(3).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Duties imposed by this Regulation not to prejudice any other duties imposed by Ordinance or other enactment
section.leadIn: The imposition of duties by this Regulation on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any prescribed building professional—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appointed under section 27; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: nominated under section 4A(5) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any prescribed registered contractor appointed under section 28,

section.continued: is without prejudice to any duties imposed on the professional or contractor by any other provision of the Ordinance or any other enactment.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Receipt of plans not to confer title to land etc.
section.leadIn: An acknowledgment of receipt of any plan or other documents in respect of any minor works by the Building Authority does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confer any title to land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: constitute a waiver of any term in any lease or licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grant any exemption from, or permit any contravention of, any provision of the Ordinance or any other enactment.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Provisions relating to Section 39C of Ordinance

section.name: s62
section.heading: Provisions relating to section 39C(1) of Ordinance

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of prescribed building or building works given by section 39C(6)(b)(i) of the Ordinance in relation to section 39C(1) of the Ordinance, the building or building works specified in Part 2 of Schedule 3 are prescribed as prescribed building or building works. (24 of 2012 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 39C(2) of the Ordinance, in relation to any building or building works prescribed under subsection (1), the following person is to be appointed to inspect the building or building works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered structural engineer;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: a registered inspector; (L.N. 148 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered general building contractor; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a registered minor works contractor who is registered for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: type A minor works under class I, class II or class III;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: type E minor works under class I, class II or class III; or

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 39C(3) of the Ordinance, the person appointed under section 39C(2) of the Ordinance and subsection (2) (appointed person) must, within 14 days after the completion of the inspection, submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 93 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form, in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who arranged for the inspection to be carried out has specified the appointed person as the person appointed under section 39C(2) of the Ordinance and subsection (2) in respect of the inspection; (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the appointed person has confirmed the appointment and the date on which the building or building works were inspected; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the appointed person has certified that the building or building works are structurally safe in the opinion of the person and comply with the Ordinance (except section 14(1) of the Ordinance and regulation 25 of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: photographs and description showing the physical condition of the building or building works as inspected.

section.name: s62A
section.heading: Provisions relating to section 39C(1A) of Ordinance

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of prescribed building or building works in section 39C(6)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance (which relates to section 39C(1A) of the Ordinance (relevant provision)), if any building or building works are of a type specified in Part 3 or 4 of Schedule 3, the building or building works are prescribed building or building works to which the relevant provision applies (relevant construction). (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: The date prescribed for the purposes of section 39C(1A)(a) of the Ordinance is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for any relevant construction that is of a type specified in Part 3 of Schedule 3—2 September 2013; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any relevant construction that is of a type specified in Part 4 of Schedule 3—1 September 2020. (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 39C(2) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a relevant construction falling within the description of an item of minor works under class I—

subparagraph.content: if the construction is a specified construction, an authorized person is to be appointed to inspect the construction; and
if the construction is not a specified construction, an authorized person and a registered structural engineer are to be appointed to inspect the construction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a relevant construction falling within the description of an item of minor works under class II or class III—one of the following persons is to be appointed to inspect the construction—

subparagraph.content: an authorized person;
a registered structural engineer;
a registered inspector;
a registered general building contractor;
a registered minor works contractor who is registered for the item;
a registered minor works contractor who is registered for the type of minor works under the class that are the minor works described in the item. (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: For section 39C(3) of the Ordinance, the person appointed under section 39C(2) of the Ordinance and subsection (3) (appointed person) must, within 14 days after the completion of the inspection, submit to the Building Authority— (L.N. 93 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notification in the specified form—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (if the relevant construction is a signboard) that contains the personal particulars and contact information of the person for whom the construction was erected, as provided by that person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in which the person who arranged for the inspection to be carried out has specified the appointed person as the person appointed under section 39C(2) of the Ordinance and subsection (3) for the inspection;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in which the appointed person has confirmed the appointment and the date on which the relevant construction was inspected; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in which the appointed person has certified that the relevant construction was structurally safe in the person’s opinion and complied with the Ordinance (except section 14(1) of the Ordinance and regulation 25 of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a photograph and description showing the physical condition of the relevant construction. (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subsection.content: For section 39C(1A)(c) of the Ordinance, if the relevant construction is a signboard and the requirements in section 39C(2), (3) and (4) of the Ordinance have been complied with in relation to it, the requirements must, within 5 years after the date of the compliance, be complied with in relation to the construction again. (L.N. 93 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)(a)—
subsection.def: specified construction (指明建築結構) means a construction that satisfies all the criteria under section 37(4).

part.name: P10
part.heading: Transitional—Registration as Registered Minor Works Contractor (Provisional)

section.name: s63
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 10
section.content: In this Part, registered minor works contractor (provisional) (臨時註冊小型工程承建商) means a person whose name is for the time being on the provisional register of minor works contractors maintained under section 8A of the Ordinance.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Application for registration as registered minor works contractor (provisional)

subsection.content: Within 2 years after the commencement of this section, a person (other than a natural person) may apply to the Building Authority for registration as a registered minor works contractor (provisional) for one or more types of minor works under one or more classes.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The applicant must, in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, nominate in the application form at least one individual who is proposed to be an authorized signatory of the applicant to act for it for the purposes of the Ordinance on its registration as a registered minor works contractor (provisional).

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to provide any information and documentary proof that the Authority considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application if the information or proof is not provided.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Determination of application for registration as registered minor works contractor (provisional)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Building Authority must, within 30 days from receiving an application under section 64(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: If the application under section 64(1) is for the registration as a registered minor works contractor (provisional) for any type or types of minor works under one or more classes including class I, the Building Authority must, within 60 days from receiving the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the application in part and refuse the remaining part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Building Authority must not allow an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b) unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each type of minor works under each class to which the application relates, at least one individual nominated under section 64(3) for that type of minor works—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has the experience specified by the Authority; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has the ability to understand that type of minor works through relevant experience and a general knowledge of the basic statutory requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its management structure is adequate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at least one of its directors has the qualifications and experience specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable for registration in the provisional register.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the applicant is suitable for registration in the provisional register for the purposes of subsection (3)(c), the Building Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant and the individual nominated under section 64(3) have any criminal record in respect of any offence under the laws of Hong Kong relating to the carrying out of any building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary order has been made against the applicant or the individual.

subsection.leadIn: If the Building Authority allows an application under subsection (1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b), the Authority must, on payment by the applicant of the prescribed fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter the applicant’s name in the provisional register together with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the authorized signatory of the applicant for each type of minor works under each class for which the applicant is registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the applicant’s name in the Gazette together with the particulars of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of provisional registration to the applicant endorsed with the particulars of the type or types of minor works under one or more classes for which the applicant is registered.

subsection.content: If the Building Authority refuses an application under subsection (1)(b) or (c) or (2)(b) or (c), the Authority must give reasons for the decision in writing to the applicant.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Validity period of provisional registration

subsection.leadIn: The provisional registration of a person under section 65 expires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2) and any relevant disciplinary order, on the expiry of 2 years after the commencement of section 28;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the date on which the person is registered as a registered minor works contractor under section 12,

subsection.content: If a registered minor works contractor (provisional) makes an application for registration under section 10(1)(b) 3 months prior to the expiry date of the provisional registration under section 65 and the validity of the provisional registration expires before the application is determined under section 12, the provisional registration continues to be in force after its expiry until the application is determined by the Building Authority under section 12.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 11
section.leadIn: In this Part—

amended type of minor works (經修訂小型工程類型)—see section 79(2)(b);
amendment date (修例日期) means 1 September 2020;
amendment provision (修訂條文) means section 14 of the 2020 Amendment Regulation;
covering item (更替項目)—see section 70(2);
new class III item (新增第III級項目)—see section 69;
pre-amended item (原有項目)—see section 68(1);

remaining period (尚餘有效期), in relation to a pre-existing registration, means the part of the validity period of the registration that falls on or after the amendment date;
removal order (除名命令) means an order made under section 13(4)(a) of the Ordinance;
repealed item (已廢除項目)—see section 70(1).

paragraph.content: 3.2 (to the extent that the repealed item relates to removal works)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3.50 (to the extent that the repealed item relates to erection and alteration works)

section.name: s71
section.heading: Certain building works remain exempt after amendment date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any building works that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: were carried out in accordance with the Ordinance before the amendment date;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: were still in progress on the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: but for this section, would have become minor works because of the amendments made to Schedule 1 by the 2020 Amendment Regulation.

subsection.content: On and after the amendment date, the building works are not regarded as minor works.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Certain building works remain as designated exempted works after amendment date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any building works that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: were carried out in accordance with the Ordinance before the amendment date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: were designated exempted works within the meaning of the pre-amended Regulation immediately before the amendment date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: were still in progress on the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: but for this section, would have ceased to be designated exempted works because of the amendments made to Schedule 2 by the 2020 Amendment Regulation.

subsection.content: On and after the amendment date, the building works are regarded as designated exempted works.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Minor works falling within description of pre-amended item carried out before amendment date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any building works that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: were commenced or carried out in accordance with the Ordinance before the amendment date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: were minor works falling within the description of a pre-amended item immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: but for the amendment provision, would have continued to be regulated under the Ordinance as minor works falling within the description of that item.

subsection.content: On and after the amendment date, the building works are regarded as minor works falling within the description of the amended item.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Minor works falling within description of repealed item to fall within description of covering item

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any building works that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: were commenced or carried out in accordance with the Ordinance before the amendment date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: were minor works falling within the description of a repealed item immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: but for the amendment provision, would have continued to be regulated under the Ordinance as minor works falling within the description of that item.

subsection.content: On and after the amendment date, the building works are regarded as minor works falling within the description of the covering item.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Registered specialist contractor may be appointed in respect of works falling within description of item 1.36

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any building works that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: were commenced or carried out in accordance with the Ordinance before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: were minor works falling within the description of item 1.36 of Part 3 of the pre-amended Schedule 1 immediately before the amendment date.

subsection.content: Despite the amendment of section 28(1)(b) by the 2020 Amendment Regulation, for the purposes of section 9AA of the Ordinance, the requirement under this Regulation to appoint a prescribed registered contractor in respect of the building works is complied with if a specified contractor is appointed in respect of the works.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified contractor (指明承建商) means a registered specialist contractor whose name is entered in the demolition works category in a sub-register in the register of specialist contractors maintained under section 8A(2) of the Ordinance.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Registration of Registered Minor Works Contractor

section.name: s76
section.heading: Pre-existing registration for pre-amended item
section.content: Subject to a removal order, a pre-existing registration as a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended item has effect for its remaining period as a registration as a registered minor works contractor for the amended item.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Pre-existing registration for repealed item
section.content: Subject to a removal order, a pre-existing registration as a registered minor works contractor for a repealed item has effect for its remaining period as a registration as a registered minor works contractor for the covering item.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Addition of new class III item to pre-existing registration

subsection.content: This section applies if Condition 1 or Condition 2 is satisfied in relation to a pre-existing registration of a person as a registered minor works contractor for an item of minor works in Part 3 of the pre-amended Schedule 1 (relevant pre-existing registration).

subsection.leadIn: Condition 1 is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant pre-existing registration was allowed or renewed under the pre-amended Regulation on the basis that the person was registered under the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583) as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division that was relevant to the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that trade division is also relevant to a new class III item.

subsection.leadIn: Condition 2 is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant pre-existing registration was allowed or renewed under the pre-amended Regulation on the basis that the person had the qualifications and experience specified by the Building Authority under section 11(2)(a)(ii) of the pre-amended Regulation for the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the qualifications and experience are also specified by the Building Authority under section 11(2)(a)(ii) for a new class III item.

subsection.content: The person is regarded as having been registered as a registered minor works contractor for the new class III item.

subsection.leadIn: The registration for the new class III item—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to a removal order, has effect for the remaining period of that pre-existing registration.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Pre-existing registration of non-natural person—amended type of minor works

subsection.content: Subject to a removal order, a pre-existing registration as a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended type of minor works has effect for its remaining period as a registration as a registered minor works contractor for the amended type of minor works.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: each of the following types of minor works is a pre-amended type of minor works—

subparagraph.content: type C minor works under class II or class III specified in Part 2 of the pre-amended Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the type as amended by the amendment provision is, in relation to the type, the amended type of minor works.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Pre-existing registration of non-natural person—authorized signatory

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a person (relevant person) appeared in the register immediately before the amendment date as an authorized signatory of a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended type of minor works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had there been no 2020 Amendment Regulation, the relevant person would have continued to be the authorized signatory of the contractor for that type of minor works on the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration of the contractor is a pre-existing registration having effect under section 79(1) on the amendment date.

subsection.content: The name of the relevant person is regarded as having been entered in the register on the amendment date as the authorized signatory of the contractor for the amended type of minor works.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Validity period of registration not affected

subsection.content: A pre-existing registration having effect under section 76, 77 or 79(1) expires on the date on which it would have expired if there had been no 2020 Amendment Regulation.
Any other pre-existing registration as a registered minor works contractor expires on the date on which it is to expire under this Regulation.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 4 of Part 11
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: affected item (受影響項目) means—(a)a pre-amended item; or(b)a repealed item;
applicable item (適用項目)—(a)in relation to a pre-amended item—means the amended item;(b)in relation to a repealed item—means the covering item.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Application under section 10(1)(a) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.content: This section applies if an application for registration as a registered minor works contractor made under section 10(1)(a) was pending immediately before the amendment date.
The application is regarded as an application made under section 10(1)(a) of the amended Regulation.

If the application is for registration as a registered minor works contractor for an affected item, the application is regarded as an application for registration as a registered minor works contractor for the applicable item.
If the application is eventually allowed, section 78 applies as if the registration to which the application relates were a pre-existing registration.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Application under section 10(1)(b) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.content: This section applies if an application for registration as a registered minor works contractor made under section 10(1)(b) was pending immediately before the amendment date.
The application is regarded as an application made under section 10(1)(b) of the amended Regulation.

If the application is for registration as a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended type of minor works, the application is regarded as an application for registration as a registered minor works contractor for the amended type of minor works.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Application under section 14(1) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.content: This section applies if an application made by a registered minor works contractor for the renewal of the contractor’s registration under section 14(1) was pending immediately before the amendment date.
The application is regarded as an application made under section 14(1) of the amended Regulation.

If the registration to which the application relates is a registration having effect under section 76, 77 or 79(1) (latter), the application is regarded as an application for the renewal of the latter.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Supplementary provision to section 85

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made by a registered minor works contractor for the renewal of the contractor’s registration under section 14(1) was pending immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: because of that registration, the contractor is regarded under section 78 as having been registered as a registered minor works contractor for a new class III item.

subsection.content: The application is regarded as having also been made for the renewal of the registration for the new class III item.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Application under section 18(1) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.content: This section applies if an application for the restoration of a person’s name to the register made under section 18(1) was pending immediately before the amendment date.
The application is regarded as an application made under section 18(1) of the amended Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: If the registration to which the application relates is a registration for an affected item—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration is regarded as a registration for the applicable item (specified registration); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is regarded as an application relating to the specified registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the registration to which the application relates is a registration for a pre-amended type of minor works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration is regarded as a registration for the amended type of minor works (relevant registration); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is regarded as an application relating to the relevant registration.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Supplementary provision to section 87

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the restoration of a person’s name to the register made under section 18(1) (restoration application) was pending immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person (applicant) would have been allowed for registration as a registered minor works contractor for a new class III item under section 78 had the registration to which the restoration application relates been a pre-existing registration.

subsection.content: If the restoration application is allowed under section 19 of the amended Regulation, the applicant is regarded as having also been registered as a registered minor works contractor for the new class III item.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Application under section 18(1) on or after amendment date

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended item was removed from the register under section 17(1) and was not restored to the register before the amendment date in relation to that item under section 19; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application is made, on or after the amendment date, by the contractor under section 18(1) of the amended Regulation in relation to the registration.

subsection.content: The registration is regarded as a registration for the amended item, and the application is regarded as an application relating to that registration.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a registered minor works contractor for a pre-amended type of minor works was removed from the register under section 17(1) and was not restored to the register before the amendment date in relation to that type of minor works under section 19; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application is made, on or after the amendment date, by the contractor under section 18(1) of the amended Regulation in relation to the registration.

subsection.content: The registration is regarded as a registration for the amended type of minor works, and the application is regarded as an application relating to that registration.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Application under section 21(1) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made by a registered minor works contractor for the addition to the contractor’s registration of one or more additional items of class III minor works (additional item) under section 21(1) was pending immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had there been no 2020 Amendment Regulation, the registration to which the application relates would have continued to be in force on the amendment date.

subsection.content: The application is regarded as an application made under section 21(1) of the amended Regulation.
If the additional item is an affected item, the application is regarded as an application for the addition of the applicable item.
If the application is eventually allowed, section 78 applies as if the registration to which the application relates were a pre-existing registration.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Application under section 21(2) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made by a registered minor works contractor for the addition to the contractor’s registration of one or more additional types or classes of minor works under section 21(2) was pending immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had there been no 2020 Amendment Regulation, the registration to which the application relates would have continued to be in force on the amendment date.

subsection.content: The application is regarded as an application made under section 21(2) of the amended Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: If the application relates to the addition of a specified type and class that is amended by the amendment provision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is regarded as an application for the addition of the specified type and class as amended by that provision (amended type and class); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual who is nominated under section 21(4) of the pre-amended Regulation in respect of the specified type and class is regarded as having been nominated under section 21(4) of the amended Regulation in respect of the amended type and class.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified type and class (指明類型及級別) means—(a)a type of minor works under a class as specified in Part 2 of the pre-amended Schedule 1; or(b)a class of minor works of a type as specified in that Part.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Application under section 24(1) of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made by a registered minor works contractor for the approval of a nomination of additional authorized signatory under section 24(1) was pending immediately before the amendment date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had there been no 2020 Amendment Regulation, the registration to which the application relates would have continued to be in force on the amendment date.

subsection.content: The application is regarded as an application made under section 24(1) of the amended Regulation.

If the application relates to a specified type and class within the meaning of section 91, the application is regarded as an application relating to the amended type and class within the meaning of that section.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Request for review under section 26 of pre-amended Regulation

subsection.content: If a request for review under section 26 was pending immediately before the amendment date, subject to subsection (2), the pre-amended Regulation applies to the request.
The power of the Building Authority to substitute the decision to which the request under subsection (1) relates is a power under section 26(8)(a)(ii) of the amended Regulation.

section.name: s1

non-private garden (非私人花園) means a garden, or a part of a garden, that is not a private garden; (L.N. 60 of 2020)

heading.inline: For the purposes of items 1.46, 1.47, 2.46 and 3.48 of Part 3 of this Schedule and item 23 of Part 2 of Schedule 2, a cross-sectional dimension of a ventilation duct is the internal height, internal width or internal diameter of the duct measured by reference to a vertical cross section of the duct when the duct is laid horizontally.

A description of any item of minor works specified in Part 3 of this Schedule must be read as including any make-good works that are reasonably required for the purpose of carrying out the minor works.
A description of an item of minor works specified in Part 3 of this Schedule that involves any alteration works must be read as including any strengthening works for that item.
A description of an item of minor works specified in Part 3 of this Schedule that involves any erection works must be read as including any replacement of that item.

A description of an item of minor works specified in Part 3 of this Schedule that involves any removal works must be read as including any removal works for any structure that falls within the description of that item and is an unauthorized structure.

A description of an item of minor works specified in Part 3 of this Schedule that involves any alteration works must be read as including any alteration, rectification or reinforcement works under section 39C(4) of the Ordinance.

items 3.12, 3.44, 3.45, 3.46, 3.51, 3.52, 3.53, 3.57, 3.58, 3.59, 3.60, 3.61 and 3.62 of Part 3 of this Schedule.

Type C minor works under class III are those minor works described in items 3.16, 3.17, 3.18, 3.19, 3.20, 3.21 and 3.22 of Part 3 of this Schedule.

Type G minor works under class II are those minor works described in items 2.2, 2.4, 2.9, 2.12, 2.24, 2.25, 2.26, 2.27, 2.31, 2.32, 2.37, 2.38, 2.39, 2.40, 2.63, 2.64, 2.65, 2.66 and 2.67 of Part 3 of this Schedule.

division.heading: Type H (Works relating to Ventilation System inside Building)

Type H minor works under class II are those minor works described in items 2.42 and 2.46 of Part 3 of this Schedule.

td.p: Erection or alteration of any internal staircase that is not used as a means of escape or a means of access for firefighting and rescue, provided that—
the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab; and
the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements, except a simply supported beam that—
is not of pre-stressed construction; and
is not used to support any column, flat slab or ribbed beam.
Formation of any opening in a slab, provided that—
the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;
the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements, except a simply supported beam that—
is not of pre-stressed construction; and
is not used to support any column, flat slab or ribbed beam; and
the area of the opening is more than 1 m2 but not more than 4.5 m2.
Building works associated with the installation or alteration of any service lift, provided that—
the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;
the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements, except a simply supported beam that—
is not of pre-stressed construction; and
is not used to support any column, flat slab or ribbed beam;
the rated load of the lift is not more than 250 kg;
the internal floor area of the lift car is not more than 1 m2; and
the internal height of the lift car is not more than 1.2 m.
Building works associated with the installation or alteration of any stairlift or lifting platform, provided that—
the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab; and
the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements, except a simply supported beam that—
is not of pre-stressed construction; and
is not used to support any column, flat slab or ribbed beam.
Removal of—
any supporting structure for a building services installation, or any metal casing for such an installation, located on a cantilevered slab with a span of more than 1 m; or
any ventilation duct or associated supporting frame located on, or hung underneath the soffit of, a cantilevered slab with a span of more than 1 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

Erection, alteration or removal of any protective barrier (other than an external reinforced concrete wall or block wall), provided that the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Erection or alteration of any solid fence wall on-grade, but only if—
the works do not fall within the description of item 5 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 or item 2.6. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Erection or alteration of any external mesh fence or metal railing (with or without a solid fence wall as its lower part) (structure) on-grade, but only if—
the height of the structure, including any feature at its top, is not more than 10 m;
if the lower part of the structure is a solid fence wall—the height of the wall alone is not more than 3 m; and
the works do not fall within the description of item 16 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 or item 2.7. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Removal of any solid fence wall on-grade, but only if the works do not fall within the description of item 5 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 or item 3.4. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

Removal of any external mesh fence (with or without a solid fence wall as its lower part), metal railing (with or without a solid fence wall as its lower part) or pole on-grade, but only if the works do not fall within the description of item 6 or 17 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 or item 2.66, 2.67, 3.5 or 3.66. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Construction or alteration of any spread footing associated with the carrying out of any other minor works or designated exempted works, provided that—
the works involve an excavation of a depth of not more than 3 m;
the overall gradient of the area bounded by lines 10 m away from the location of the footing in the downhill direction is not more than 15 degrees;
there is no slope steeper than 15 degrees within the area mentioned in paragraph (b);
there is no retaining wall or terrace wall higher than 1.5 m, or below a line drawn down from the base of the footing that is 45 degrees to the horizontal, within the area mentioned in paragraph (b);
the footing is not founded on soft clay or mud; and (L.N. 60 of 2020)
the works do not fall within the description of item 2.10.

Excavation works associated with the carrying out of any other minor works or designated exempted works, but only if the depth of the excavation is more than 1.5 m but not more than 3 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Erection or alteration of any supporting structure for a radio base station solely for telecommunications services in the form of an equipment cabinet on the roof of a building, provided that—
the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;
the length of the cabinet is not more than 1.5 m;

section.def: aggregate length of any additional wall (加建牆壁總長度), in relation to works carried out on a roof, means the difference between—(a)the total length of the non-load bearing walls (excluding the width of any door openings on the walls) on the roof (wall length) as shown on the approved plan; and(b)the wall length as measured at the completion of the works;
cross-sectional dimension (橫切面尺寸) has the meaning given by section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1;

display area (展示面積), in relation to a signboard, means the area of the largest planar surface of a virtual rectangular prism containing all parts of the signboard (including its supporting structure) except any structural elements of the signboard solely for preventing the lateral movement of the signboard;
inaccessible roof (非開放屋頂) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
planter (花槽) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
roof finishes (屋頂飾面) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
unauthorized (違例) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1.

heading.inline: A description of any item of designated exempted works specified in Part 2 of this Schedule must be read as including any make-good works that are reasonably required for the purpose of carrying out the designated exempted works.

section.name: s3
section.content: A description of an item of designated exempted works specified in Part 2 of this Schedule that involves any alteration works must be read as including any strengthening works for that item.

section.name: s4
section.content: A description of an item of designated exempted works specified in Part 2 of this Schedule that involves any erection works must be read as including any replacement of that item.

section.name: s5
section.content: A description of an item of designated exempted works specified in Part 2 of this Schedule that involves any removal works must be read as including any removal works for any structure that falls within the description of that item and is an unauthorized structure.

td.p: Formation of any opening in a slab, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the distance between the 2 points that are farthest away from each other within the area of the opening is not more than 150 mm; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if there is already an opening in the slab, the distance between the centre of the opening to be formed and any other opening in the slab is not less than 450 mm.

td.p: Reinstatement in accordance with the original design of a slab in respect of which an opening has been formed, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the distance between the 2 points that are farthest away from each other within the area of the opening is not more than 150 mm.

td.p: Replacement of any glass reinforced polyester water tank in accordance with the original design, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the capacity of the tank is not more than 9 m3 and the water head of the tank is not more than 2 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the tank is located on the roof of a building, the distance between the tank and the edge of the roof is more than 1.5 m.

td.p: Removal of any glass reinforced polyester water tank, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the capacity of the tank is not more than 9 m3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the tank is located on the roof of a building, the distance between the tank and the edge of the roof is more than 1.5 m.

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any solid fence wall on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the wall is not more than 1.1 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the wall is not used as a protective barrier. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Repair or removal of any external mesh fence or metal railing (with or without a solid fence wall as its lower part) (structure) on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the structure, including any feature at its top, is not more than 3 m;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the lower part of the structure is a solid fence wall—the height of the wall alone is not more than 1.1 m; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the structure is not used as a protective barrier. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Laying, repair or removal of any external rendering, external wall tile or roof finishes of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for external rendering and external wall tile—the distance between the highest point of the rendering or tile and the adjoining ground or adjoining roof (as the case requires) is not more than 3 m;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for roof finishes—

subparagraph.content: the gradient of the roof is not more than 1 in 4; and
the roof is not an inaccessible roof; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for works that involve the laying or repair of roof finishes—at the completion of the works, the thickness of the finishes is not more than that in the original design of the finishes. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any metal gate at a fence wall or at an entrance to a building, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the weight of each leaf of the gate is not more than 100 kg;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the width of each leaf of the gate is not more than 1.2 m; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the height of the gate is not more than 2.2 m.

td.p: Excavation works of a depth of not more than 300 mm. (L.N. 60 of 2020)
Erection or alteration of any signboard (including the replacement of the display surface of any signboard) fixed to the external wall of a building, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the display area of the signboard is not more than 1 m2;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signboard does not comprise any display system consisting of light emitting diodes;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: no part of the signboard projects more than 150 mm from the wall; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the distance between any part of the signboard and the ground is not more than 3 m.

td.p: Removal of any signboard fixed to the external wall of a building, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the display area of the signboard is not more than 1 m2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the signboard does not comprise any display system consisting of light emitting diodes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no part of the signboard projects more than 600 mm from the wall; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the distance between any part of the signboard and the ground is not more than 3 m.

for a supporting structure—the height of the structure is not more than 1 m; and

subparagraph.leadIn: for a supporting structure or casing located on a roof of a building—

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.leadIn: the duct or frame is located—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on a roof (other than a cantilevered slab) of a building;
the height of the duct or frame is not more than 1 m; and

subparagraph.leadIn: for a duct or frame located on a roof of a building—

subparagraph.name: A
B

td.p: Erection, alteration or removal of any supporting frame projecting from an external wall of a building, but only if— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the frame is for supporting an air-conditioning unit or light fitting; (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no part of the frame projects more than 600 mm from the wall;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the frame and— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subparagraph.content: if the frame is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the frame is designed for an air-conditioning unit or light fitting (as the case requires) of not more than 100 kg in weight; and (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the frame does not project over any street or common part of the building.

td.p: Erection, alteration or removal of any canopy projecting from the external wall of a building, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the canopy is not constructed of concrete;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no part of the canopy projects more than 500 mm from the wall;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the canopy and— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subparagraph.content: if the canopy is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; and (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the canopy does not project over any street or common part of the building.

td.p: Erection, alteration or removal of any drying rack projecting from the external wall of a building, provided that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no part of the rack projects more than 750 mm from the wall;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the rack and— (L.N. 60 of 2020)

subparagraph.content: if the rack is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; and (L.N. 60 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the rack does not project over any street or common part of the building.

td.p: Erection or alteration of any external mesh fence or metal railing (with or without a solid fence wall as its lower part) (structure) on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the structure, including any feature at its top, is not more than 3 m;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the structure is not used as a protective barrier. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any external pole on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the pole, including any feature at its top, is not more than 3 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for erection or alteration works—the weight of the pole, including any feature at its top but excluding any pedestal, is not more than 100 kg. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any mesh fence or metal railing on a roof of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the height of the fence or railing, including any feature at its top, is not more than 1.1 m;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lower part of the fence or railing, excluding any pedestal, is not a solid fence wall;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fence or railing is not used as a protective barrier; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is no protective barrier of a height of not less than 1.1 m at any edge of the roof—the distance between any part of the fence or railing and that edge is more than 1.5 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any pole on a roof of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the height of the pole, including any feature at its top, is not more than 1.1 m;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is no protective barrier of a height of not less than 1.1 m at any edge of the roof—the distance between any part of the pole and that edge is more than 1.5 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for erection or alteration works—if there is more than one pole on the roof, the poles are at least 2.5 m away from each other. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

p.content: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any solid fence wall (the wall) on a roof of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any other structural elements;

paragraph.name: c
a
paragraph.content: the height of the wall is not more than 500 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the thickness of the wall is not more than 100 mm;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the density of the wall is not more than 650 kg per m3; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if there is no protective barrier of a height of not less than 1.1 m at any edge of the roof—the distance between any part of the wall and that edge is more than 1.5 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection of any mesh fence, metal railing or pole on top of a solid fence wall (other than an unauthorized solid fence wall) (wall) on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of the wall alone is not more than 2.5 m;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aggregate height of the wall and the fence, railing or pole, including any feature at its top, is not more than 3 m; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a mesh fence or metal railing—the fence or railing is not used as a protective barrier. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration or removal of any external metal ventilation duct (duct), or associated supporting frame (frame), on-grade or on a roof of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the distance between the highest point of the duct or frame and the adjoining ground or adjoining roof (as the case requires) is not more than 900 mm; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a duct or frame located on a roof—if there is no protective barrier of a height of not less than 1.1 m at any edge of the roof, the distance between any part of the duct or frame and that edge is more than 1.5 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration or removal of any external metal ventilation duct or associated supporting frame, but only if the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the duct or frame projects from an external wall of a building, and—

subparagraph.content: no part of the duct or frame projects more than 750 mm from the wall;

subparagraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the duct or frame and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the duct or frame is above a roof—the roof; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any other case—the ground,

subparagraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; and

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the duct or frame is located on a balcony, verandah or canopy (other than a cantilevered slab) of a building, and—

subparagraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the duct or frame and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the duct or frame is above a roof—the roof; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any other case—the ground,
the distance between the highest point of the duct or frame and the balcony, verandah or canopy is not more than 900 mm; and

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the duct or frame is hung underneath the soffit of a balcony, verandah or canopy (other than a cantilevered slab) of a building, and—

subparagraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the duct or frame and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the duct or frame is above a roof—the roof; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any other case—the ground,

subparagraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; and

subparagraph.content: for erection or alteration works—the balcony, verandah or canopy does not project over any street or common part of the building. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any outdoor planter, pond or fountain on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not involve any excavation of a depth of more than 300 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for erection or alteration works—the distance between the highest point of the planter, pond or fountain and the adjoining ground is not more than 600 mm; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for repair or removal works—the distance between the highest point of the planter, pond or fountain and the adjoining ground is not more than 1.1 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Addition, alteration, repair or removal of any surface drainage channel on-grade, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the depth of the channel is not more than 300 mm; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the channel is not for any natural, formed or man-made slope or any retaining wall. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any metal supporting frame for the growing of plants that is fixed to an external wall of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the frame does not project over any street or common part of the building;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no part of the frame projects more than 300 mm from the wall; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the frame and—

subparagraph.content: if the frame is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.continued: is not more than 3 m. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any metal window security grille, or metal wind guard, for an opening on an external wall of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grille or guard does not project over any street or common part of the building;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no part of the grille or guard projects more than 300 mm from the wall;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the grille or guard and—

subparagraph.content: if the grille or guard is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.continued: is not more than 3 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a security grille or wind guard that is larger than the opening—when projecting an image of the grille or guard onto the wall, the width of the border (not including the corners) between the projected image and the opening is not more than 300 mm. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Erection, alteration, repair or removal of any cat-ladder projecting from an external wall of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works do not result in any additional load to any cantilevered slab;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the distance between the highest point of the cat-ladder and—

subparagraph.content: if the cat-ladder is above a roof—the roof; or
in any other case—the ground,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no part of the rungs of the cat-ladder projects more than 300 mm from the wall;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rungs of the cat-ladder are not wider than 500 mm; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cat-ladder does not project over any street. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Laying or replacement of any waterproofing layer on any roof surface of a building, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the waterproofing layer is a liquid-applied or membrane-applied type; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the laying or removal of any tile layer or screeding layer. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

td.p: Installation, alteration, replacement or removal of the display surface of any signboard, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the material used for the display surface is fabric sheeting or plastic; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the works do not involve the alteration of any structural elements. (L.N. 60 of 2020)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: inaccessible roof (非開放屋頂) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
non-private garden (非私人花園) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
private garden (私人花園) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
projecting signboard (伸出式招牌) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;

total length of additional wall (新建牆壁總長度), in relation to a structure on a roof, means the difference between—(a)the total length of the non-load bearing walls (excluding the width of any door openings on the walls) on the roof (roof wall length) as shown on the approved plan; and(b)the roof wall length as measured when the structure is inspected;
trellis (花棚) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;
unauthorized (違例), when used to describe any structure, means the structure is erected in contravention of any provision of the Ordinance;
wall signboard (靠牆招牌) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1.

td.p: Unauthorized supporting structure for an air-conditioning unit, water cooling tower or any associated air ducts located on-grade or on a slab (other than a cantilevered slab), provided that the structure is designed for an air-conditioning unit or water cooling tower, of not more than 100 kg in weight.
Unauthorized metal supporting frame for an air-conditioning unit or any associated air ducts projecting from the external wall of a building, provided that—
no part of the frame projects more than 600 mm from the wall;
the frame is designed for an air-conditioning unit of not more than 100 kg in weight; and
if the distance between the highest point of the frame and the ground is not more than 3 m, the frame does not project over any street or common part of the building.
Unauthorized drying rack projecting from the external wall of a building, provided that—
no part of the rack projects more than 750 mm from the wall; and
if the distance between the highest point of the rack and the ground is not more than 3 m, the rack does not project over any street or common part of the building.
Unauthorized canopy projecting from the external wall of a building, provided that—
no part of the canopy projects more than 500 mm from the wall;
the canopy is not constructed of concrete; and
if the distance between the highest point of the canopy and the ground is not more than 3 m, the canopy does not project over any street or common part of the building.
